intro: Perymenium microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed perymenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. It has a short lifespan and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
